Disebut Swasta Cari Kambing Hitam soal Tol Laut, Menhub: Kambing Putih
07 Nov 2019, 04:38 by Anisa Indraini


Foto: Usman Hadi - detikcom

Jakarta - Ketua Asosiasi Logistik Indonesia (ALI) Zaldy Masita mengkritik tuduhan pemerintah bahwa ada swasta yang melakukan monopoli terhadap aktivitas tol laut. Menurutnya, pemerintah hanya mencari 'kambing hitam' untuk menutupi kegagalan program tersebut.Menanggapi itu, Menteri Perhubungan Budi Karya Sumadi angkat bicara. Menurutnya, hal itu bukan suatu tuduhan. Melainkan adanya laporan langsung dari kepala daerah ke Presiden Joko Widodo (Jokowi)."Bukan kambing Hitam. Jadi kemarin, Presiden mendengar sendiri dari Bupati. Dia bilang, ini harganya mahal karena ada suatu pengusaha yang menguasai," kata Budi di Gedung Smesco Indonesia, Kamis (7/11/2019).Terkait kritikan yang diberikan padanya, Budi pun menanggapi dengan santai. Ia justru menjawab dengan candaan."Jadi bukan kambing hitam, kambing putih, ya," canda Budi.Hingga saat ini, Kementerian Perhubungan bersama dengan seluruh stakeholder dan shipper atau consignee sedang melaksanakan evaluasi kuota muatan dan pengawasan disparitas harga barang untuk mengetahui terjadinya potensi monopoli."Kita mengidentifikasi pola potensi monopoli terjadi itu di titik mana, hasil identifikasi kami dugaan praktik monopoli tersebut terjadi di daerah timur, seperti Maluku dan Papua," ujar Direktur Lalu Lintas dan Angkutan Laut Capt. Wisnu Handoko dalam keterangan tertulis, Minggu (3/11/2019). Simak Video "Jokowi Sebut Ada Pihak Swasta Nakal Main-main di Tol Laut"[Gambas:Video 20detik](zlf/zlf)

Called Private Looking Black Goat about Sea Toll, Menhub: White Goat
Nov 07 2019, 04:38 by Anisa Indraini


Photo: Usman Hadi - detikcom

Jakarta - Chairperson of the Indonesian Logistics Association (ALI) Zaldy Masita criticized the government's accusation that there is a private sector that has a monopoly on sea highway activities. According to him, the government was only looking for a 'scapegoat' to cover up the failure of the program. In response, Transportation Minister Budi Karya Sumadi spoke up. According to him, that was not an accusation. But there is a direct report from the regional head to President Joko Widodo (Jokowi). "Not a scapegoat. So yesterday, the President heard himself from the Regent. He said, this was expensive because there was a businessman in control," said Budi at the Smesco Indonesia Building, Thursday (11/07/2019). Regarding the criticism given to him, Budi responded casually. He actually answered with a joke. "So it is not a scapegoat, a white goat, yes," joked Budi. Until now, the Ministry of Transportation together with all stakeholders and shipper or consignee is conducting an evaluation of the quota of cargo and monitoring disparity in the price of goods to find out the potential monopoly "We identified the pattern of potential monopolies happening at which point, the results of our identification of alleged monopolistic practices occurred in the eastern regions, such as Maluku and Papua," said Director of Traffic and Sea Transportation Capt. Wisnu Handoko in written statement, Sunday (3/11/2019). Check out the video "Jokowi Call There Are Naughty Private Parties Playing in the Sea Toll" [Gambas: Video 20seconds] (zlf / zlf)
